commentary.revenue_performance: Revenue grew 2% on a 12-month basis, with a robust 19% 24-month growth. Volume growth was about 5.5%. Pricing was -2% to -3% sequentially.
commentary.profitability: Operating Margin was very healthy at 17.7%. Profitability included a significant non-recurring gain in the base quarter (Q3 FY23) due to the sale of equity in Britannia Dairy to Bel.
commentary.business_outlook: Aspiration is to get back to **double-digit volume growth soon**. Management will focus on keeping margins stable and growing the top line aggressively.
commentary.key_challenges: Sluggishness in **rural consumption**. Competitive pricing actions were required to match deflation and increased local competitor activity.
commentary.strategic_initiatives: Direct reach expanded to 27.6 lakh outlets and rural distributors to 29,000. Commercialized processed cheese line in January. Cost efficiency programs reached **7x** the 2013-14 base.
commentary.market_conditions: Overall commodity costs remained **soft** in the quarter, with downside from palm, laminates, and corrugated boxes offsetting flour/sugar inflation.
